content.text:
# Timeline of the 2008 Pacific hurricane season

The 2008 Pacific hurricane season officially started on May 15 in the East Pacific Ocean, and on June 1 in the Central Pacific; they both ended on November 30. These dates conventionally delimit the period of each year when most tropical cyclones form in the Pacific basin. The first storm of the year, Tropical Storm Alma, developed on May 29, and the last, Tropical Storm Polo dissipated on November 5.
This timeline documents all the storm formations, strengthening, weakening, landfalls, extratropical transitions, as well as dissipation. For convenience and clarity, in the timeline below, all landfalls are bolded. The timeline will also include information, when it becomes available, which was not operationally released, meaning that information from post-storm reviews by the National Hurricane Center, such as information on a storm that was not operationally warned on, have been included.
The graphical bar below gives a brief overview of storm activity during the season, and for convenience, the storm's maximum intensity is included as a color bar.
Timeline

id:GP     value:red

id:C2     value:rgb(1,0.85,0.55)  legend:Category_2_=_96–110_mph_(154–177_km/h)

id:C5     value:rgb(0.55,0.46,0.90)  legend:Category_5_=_≥157_mph_(≥252_km/h)

from:01/06/2008 till:30/06/2008 text:June

from:01/08/2008 till:31/08/2008 text:August

text:"(From the"

text:"Saffir–Simpson scale)"
May
;May 15
* The 2008 Eastern Pacific hurricane season officially begins.
;May 29
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT May 28) – Tropical Depression One-E forms  west-northwest of Cabo Blanco, Costa Rica.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. May 28) – Tropical Depression One-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Alma.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m.) – Tropical Storm Alma attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
* 1945 UTC (12:45 p.m.) – Tropical Storm Alma makes landfall near Leon, Nicaragua.
;May 30
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. May 29) – Tropical Storm Alma weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 p.m.) – Tropical Depression Alma dissipates.
June
;June 1
* The Central Pacific hurricane season officially begins.
;June 27
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT June 26) – Tropical Depression Two-E forms  south-southwest of Manzanillo, Mexico.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Two-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Boris.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Three-E forms  southwest of the southern tip of Baja California.
;June 28
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Three-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Cristina.
;June 29
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT July 28) – Tropical Storm Cristina attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;July 30
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Cristina weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Cristina weakens into a remnant low.
July
;July 1
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT June 30) – Tropical Storm Boris strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Boris weakens back to a tropical storm.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Four-E forms  southwest of Manzanillo, Mexico.
;July 2
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT July 1) – Tropical Storm Boris reintensifies into a Category 1 hurricane.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 1) – Hurricane Boris attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Boris weakens back to a tropical storm.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Four-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Douglas. Simultaneously, Douglas attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;July 3
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Douglas weakens into a tropical depression.
;July 4
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT July 3) – Tropical Storm Boris weakens into a tropical depression.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 3) – Tropical Depression Douglas weakens into a remnant low.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Boris weakens into a remnant low.
;July 5
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Five-E forms  south-southeast of Acapulco, Mexico.
;July 6
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Five-E attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;July 7
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Five-E dissipates.
;July 11
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Six-E forms  southeast of Acapulco, Mexico.
;July 12
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 11) – Tropical Depression Six-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Elida.
;July 14
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Elida strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;July 16
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 15) – Tropical Depression Seven-E forms  southeast of Acapulco, Mexico.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Seven-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Fausto.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Elida strengthens into a Category 2 hurricane. Simultaneously, Elida attains its peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;July 17
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Elida weakens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;July 18
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 17) – Hurricane Elida weakens into a tropical storm.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Fausto strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;July 19
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 18) – Tropical Storm Elida weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Elida weakens into a remnant low.
;July 20
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Fausto attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;July 21
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Eight-E forms  south-southwest of Acapulco, Mexico.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Fausto weakens into a tropical storm.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Eight-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Genevieve.
;July 22
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Fausto weakens into a tropical depression.
;July 23
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT July 22) – Tropical Depression Fausto weakens into a remnant low.
;July 25
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Genevieve strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane. Simultaneously, Genevieve attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;July 26
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 25) – Hurricane Genevieve weakens into a tropical storm.
;July 27
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT July 26) – Tropical Storm Genevieve weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Genevieve weakens into a remnant low.
August
;August 6
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Nine-E forms  south of Cabo San Lucas, Mexico.
;August 7
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 6) – Tropical Depression Nine-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Hernan.
* 0000 UTC (2:00 p.m. PDT August 6) – Tropical Depression One-C forms  southeast of Hilo, Hawaii.
* 0600 UTC (8:00 p.m. HST August 6) – Tropical Depression One-C strengthens into Tropical Storm Kika.
* 1800 UTC (8:00 a.m. HST) – Tropical Storm Kika attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;August 8
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Hernan strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane.
* 1800 UTC (8:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Kika weakens into a tropical depression.
;August 9
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT August 8) – Hurricane Hernan strengthens into a Category 2 hurricane.
* 0600 UTC (8:00 p.m. HST August 8) – Tropical Depression Kika restrengthens into a tropical storm.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Hernan strengthens into a Category 3 major hurricane. Simultaneously, Hernan attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;August 10
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT August 9) – Hurricane Hernan weakens into a Category 2 hurricane.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Hernan weakens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;August 11
* 0000 UTC (2:00 p.m. HST August 10) – Tropical Storm Kika weakens back into a tropical depression.
;August 12
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 11) – Hurricane Hernan weakens into a tropical storm.
* 1200 UTC (2:00 a.m. HST) – Tropical Depression Kika weakens into a tropical disturbance.
;August 13
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 12) – Tropical Storm Hernan weakens into a remnant low.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Ten-E forms  south-southwest of Manzanillo, Mexico.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Ten-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Iselle.
;August 14
* 0600 UTC (8:00 p.m. PDT August 13) – Tropical Disturbance Kika moves west of the International Date Line.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Iselle reaches peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;August 16
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 15) – Tropical Storm Iselle weakens into a tropical depression.
;August 17
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 16) – Tropical Depression Iselle weakens into a remnant low.
;August 23
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Eleven-E forms  south-southeast of the southern tip of Baja California.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Eleven-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Julio.
;August 24
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Julio attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;August 25
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 24) – Tropical Storm Julio makes landfall near La Paz, Mexico with winds of .
;August 26
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT August 25) – Tropical Storm Julio weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Julio weakens into a remnant low.
September
;September 2
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT September 1) – Tropical Depression Twelve-E forms  south-southwest of the southern tip of Baja California.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Twelve-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Karina. Simultaneously, Karina attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;September 3
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT September 2) – Tropical Storm Karina weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Karina weakens into a remnant low.
;September 6
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Thirteen-E forms  south-southwest of Manzanillo, Mexico.
;September 7
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT September 6) – Tropical Depression Thirteen-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Lowell.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Lowell attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;September 10
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT September 9) – Tropical Storm Lowell weakens into a tropical depression.
;September 11
* 0900 UTC (2:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Lowell makes landfall near Cabo San Lucas, Mexico with winds of
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Lowell dissipates.
October
;October 1
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT September 30) – Tropical Depression Fourteen-E forms  south-southwest of the southern tip of Baja California.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Fourteen-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Marie.
;October 3
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Marie strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;October 4
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 3) – Hurricane Marie attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 3) – Tropical Depression Fifteen-E forms  south of Acapulco, Mexico.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Marie weakens into a tropical storm.
;October 5
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 4) – Tropical Depression Fifteen-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Norbert.
;October 6
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Marie weakens into a tropical depression.
;October 7
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 6) – Tropical Depression Marie weakens into a remnant low.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT October 6) – Tropical Storm Norbert strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;October 8
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 7) – Hurricane Norbert strengthens into a Category 2 hurricane.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT October 7) – Hurricane Norbert strengthens into a Category 3 major hurricane.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Sixteen-E forms  southwest of San Salvador, El Salvador.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Norbert strengthens into a Category 4 major hurricane. Simultaneously, Norbert attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;October 9
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 8) – Hurricane Norbert weakens into a Category 3 major hurricane.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT October 8) – Tropical Depression Sixteen-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Odile.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Norbert weakens into a Category 2 hurricane.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Norbert weakens into a Category 1 hurricane.
;October 11
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 10) – Hurricane Norbert restrengthens into a Category 2 hurricane.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT October 10) – Hurricane Norbert restrengthens into a Category 3 major hurricane.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT October 10) – Tropical Storm Odile attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Norbert weakens back into a Category 2 hurricane.
* 1630 UTC (9:30 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Norbert makes first landfall near Puerto Chale, Mexico with winds of .
;October 12
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT October 11) – Hurricane Norbert weakens back into a Category 1 hurricane.
* 0400 UTC (9:00 p.m. PDT October 11) – Hurricane Norbert makes second landfall near Huatabampo, Mexico with winds of .
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT October 11) – Tropical Storm Odile weakens into a tropical depression.
* 0700 UTC (12:00 a.m. PDT) – Hurricane Norbert weakens into a tropical storm.
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Storm Norbert weakens into a tropical depression.
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Norbert dissipates.
;October 13
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Odile weakens into a remnant low.
;October 23
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT October 22) – Tropical Depression Seventeen-E forms  south of Manzanillo, Mexico.
;October 24
* 1800 UTC (11:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Seventeen-E weakens into a remnant low.
November
;November 2
* 1200 UTC (5:00 a.m. PDT) – Tropical Depression Eighteen-E forms  south of the southern tip of Baja California.
;November 3
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT November 2) – Tropical Depression Eighteen-E strengthens into Tropical Storm Polo.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT November 2) – Tropical Storm Polo attains peak intensity with winds reaching  and a central pressure of .
;November 5
* 0000 UTC (5:00 p.m. PDT November 4) – Tropical Storm Polo weakens into a tropical depression.
* 0600 UTC (11:00 p.m. PDT November 4) – Tropical Depression Polo dissipates.
;November 30
* The 2008 Central and Eastern Pacific hurricane seasons end.
References
See also
*Timeline of the 2008 Atlantic hurricane season
*Timeline of the 2008 Pacific typhoon season
*Timeline of the 2008 North Indian Ocean cyclone season

*Australian region cyclone seasons: 2007–08, 2008–09
*South Pacific cyclone seasons:2007–08, 2008–09
